Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
Polygon
public class Polygon
extends java.lang.Object
Polygon Class Represent a Polygon in the Polar System - by array of Vertexes
Version:
05.12.2020
Author:
Segev Kestenbaum

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Polygon()
    Constructor of the class Initiate all private attributes of Class

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean addVertex​(double x, double y)
    The method will try to add a new vertex to the Array
    double calcArea()
    The method will calculate the Area of the Polygon using the Heron Formula
    double calcPerimeter()
    The method will calculate and return the Perimeter of the Polygon
    int findVertex​(Point p)
    The method will try to find a given point in between the vertices - if found - returns true, else - false.
    Polygon getBoundingBox()
    The method will return a Polygon object - represent the bounding box rectangle to the polygon
    Point getNextVertex​(Point p)
    The method will return the next Point in the Polygon, after the given point, If the Point given is not exist in the polygon, - return null;
    Point highestVertex()
    The method will return a copy of the Vertex that is the highest in the Polygon
    boolean isBigger​(Polygon other)
    The method will check if the current Polygon is bigger than the parameter Polygon by checking which area is bigger.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Overrides the existing toString method

    • Polygon

      public Polygon()
      Constructor of the class Initiate all private attributes of Class

  • Method Details

    • addVertex

      public boolean addVertex​(double x, double y)
      The method will try to add a new vertex to the Array
      Parameters:
      x - value of the Vertex coordinate
      y - value of the Vertex coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the insertion made succesfuly, else false;

    • highestVertex

      public Point highestVertex()
      The method will return a copy of the Vertex that is the highest in the Polygon
      Returns:
      a copy of the Point with the highest Y value - the highest Point

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides the existing toString method
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the string will contain a sentence of explanation with the coordinates

    • calcPerimeter

      public double calcPerimeter()
      The method will calculate and return the Perimeter of the Polygon
      Returns:
      the perimeter of the all the Polygon

    • calcArea

      public double calcArea()
      The method will calculate the Area of the Polygon using the Heron Formula
      Returns:
      a number represent the Area of the Polygon

    • isBigger

      public boolean isBigger​(Polygon other)
      The method will check if the current Polygon is bigger than the parameter Polygon by checking which area is bigger.
      Parameters:
      other - a new Polygon to check areas with the current Polygon
      Returns:
      true if the current Polygon is bigger that the Parameter

    • findVertex

      public int findVertex​(Point p)
      The method will try to find a given point in between the vertices - if found - returns true, else - false.
      Parameters:
      p - represent a new point to find in the Array of vertices
      Returns:
      the index of the matched point if matched, else -1.

    • getNextVertex

      public Point getNextVertex​(Point p)
      The method will return the next Point in the Polygon, after the given point, If the Point given is not exist in the polygon, - return null;
      Parameters:
      p - represent a point, if exist in the Array of polygon
      Returns:
      the next point in the Array after the parameter point, if not exist - return null

    • getBoundingBox

      public Polygon getBoundingBox()
      The method will return a Polygon object - represent the bounding box rectangle to the polygon
      Returns:
      Polygon Object - Bounding rectangle of the Polygon
